forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 6 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 5pm. Mostly sunny, with a high near 58. West southwest wind 5 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
As night drapes itself over Downtown San Francisco, a delicate interplay of partly cloudy skies hints at the possibility of a few drops of rain, though the air remains crisp and cool, holding a low temperature of around 48 degrees. The gentle waft of the evening breeze carries the scent of the nearby sea, with winds whispering softly from the west northwest, promising a somewhat mild venture into the night ahead. The city lights flicker against the backdrop of darkening clouds, lending an air of mystique to the streets below.

Tomorrow unfolds with a similar story—a potential sprinkle of rain weaving its way through the daylight hours, yet the sun will valiantly break through, coaxing warm rays to dance on the cool temperature of around 58 degrees. The embrace of a light west-southwest wind may offer just the right touch for comfort. As you step outside, a layered look of a light jacket or sweater paired with a comfortable shirt would suit the shifting weather beautifully. Consider a stroll along the waterfront, perhaps indulging in a quiet morning coffee or a contemplative walk among the still waking city—allowing the gentle fluctuations of weather to become a companion in your exploration as the day breathes life back into its vibrant corners.
